page.title: 06Vera Sampson of Norwell
page.content: { Mrs Vera Sampson}was born in{1912} {in Norwell}and has lived there all her life. Her father was the first person to have a crystal set. She remembers the time when all of the roads were{cobbled}and how she used to travel to Newark by{horse and {carriage.}The games she used to play are different to ones we play today; whip and top, fox and hounds, paper chasing. She remembers 2 pubs, 2 shops, a joiner, a black smith, a butcher, and a wheelwright in the village. In 1984 {Karl Brown,}who is 24, set himself up as a{farrier}and he is the only practising blacksmith in the area. Nowadays, many children in our school go abroad for their holidays but the highlight of Mrs Sampson's holiday was swimming with her friends in the nearby {Beck. }
